title: Helen Mirren, 74, cuts a casually chic figure in a paisley neck scarf and cream blouse at studios
text:
She's currently on a promotional tour for her new series, Catherine the Great.

And next on Helen Mirren's list was a stop at the SiriusXM Hollywood Studios in Los Angeles on Wednesday.

Clad in an effortlessly stylish ensemble, the 74-year-old actress looked radiant as she posed on the red carpet outside the booth.

Chic: She's currently on a promotional tour for her new series, Catherine the Great. And next on Helen Mirren's list was the SiriusXM Hollywood Studios in Los Angeles on Wednesday

Dame Helen kept things casually chic as she layered a paisley scarf over a cream blouse.

She teamed the garment with smart cropped black trousers, whilst a pair of snakeskin heels injected some colour into the look.

Keeping her accessories low-key, Dame Helen finished off the look with a pair of delicate silver earrings.

Chic and cheerful: Clad in an effortlessly stylish ensemble, the 74-year-old actress looked radiant as she posed on the red carpet outside the booth

Helen's latest role is in Catherine the Great where she plays the titular character during her reign as Empress of Russia.

The four-part drama will chart the latter years of Catherine’s 34-year reign and was filmed in Russia, Latvia and Lithuania.

Following the assassination of her husband Emperor Peter III in 1762, Catherine was rumoured to have had a string of male lovers and children through illicit affairs.

The series will particularly focus on Catherine's relationship with Russian statesman Grigory, who is played by Terminator Genisys star Jason Clarke.

The miniseries premiered on 3 October 3 on Sky Atlantic in the United Kingdom and will air on October 21 in the United States.

Stylish: Dame Helen kept things casually chic as she layered a paisley scarf over a cream blouse (pictured with editor Jess Cagle)

It is Helen's first major television role for 13 years, having last played Queen Elizabeth I in a Channel 4 miniseries.

Speaking to the Daily Mail's Baz Bamigboye, Helen gave an insight into her love life while speaking about her role in the show.

‘I’ve had probably three or four serious lovers. I was serially monogamous until I met my husband. And now I’m just monogamous,’ said the star, whose lovers included Liam Neeson, before she married the ‘love of my life’ director Taylor Hackford 22 years ago.
